unittitle.value: Randall Smith Collection on Maritime Radicalism

p.value: Identification of item, date; Randall Smith collection on Maritime Radicalism; TAM 203; box number; folder number; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.
Donated by Elizabeth Bouvier in 1998. The accession number associated with this gift is 1998.009.

Randall B. "Pete" Smith (1917-1989) served in Abraham Lincoln Brigade during Spanish Civil War, and later moved to New York where he was a radical activist within the National Maritime Union in the 1930s and 1940s. Smith subsequently worked as marketing executive.
This collection includes Marine Workers Historical Association minutes and correspondence; autobiographical transcripts; correspondence and other materials.

subject.value: Labor unions and communism -- United States.
Merchant mariners |z United States |x History |y 20th century
